sen.j: 山中 長俊（やまなか ながとし、天文 (元号)16年（1547年） - 慶長12年2月24日 (旧暦)（1607年3月21日））は、安土桃山時代の大名。
sen.e: Nagatoshi YAMANAKA (1547-March 21, 1607) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who lived during Azuchi-Momoyama period.
Nagatoshi YAMANAKA (1547-March 21, 1607) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who lived in the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: during Azuchi-Momoyama period→in the Azuchi-Momoyama periodに訂正しました。
sen.e: Nagatoshi YAMANAKA (1547-March 21, 1607) was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) who lived during the Azuchi-Momoyama period.

sen.j: 山中為俊の子。
sen.e: He was the son of Tametoshi YAMANAKA.
He was a son of Tametoshi YAMANAKA.
He was a son of Tametoshi YAMANAKA.

sen.j: 官位は従五位下、山城守。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and Yamashiro no kami (Governor of Yamashiro Province).
His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and "Yamashiro no kami" (Governor of Yamashiro Province).
sen.cmt: 長い役職に""をつけました。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) and "Yamashiro no kami" (Governor of Yamashiro Province).

sen.j: 通称、吉内、橘内。
sen.e: His common names were Kichinai and Kitsunai.
He was given sobriquets "Kichinai" and "Kitsunari."
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was given sobriquets "Kichinai" and "Kitsunari."

sen.j: 子は山中信俊、山中友俊、山中盛俊。
sen.e: He had three sons: Nobutoshi YAMANAKA, Tomotoshi YAMANAKA and Moritoshi YAMANAKA.
He had three sons: Nobutoshi YAMANAKA, Tomotoshi YAMANAKA and Moritoshi YAMANAKA.
He had three sons: Nobutoshi YAMANAKA, Tomotoshi YAMANAKA and Moritoshi YAMANAKA.

sen.j: 近江国甲賀郡の出で、甲賀二十一家の山中氏の庶流（南北朝時代に分かれている）。
sen.e: He was from Koga gun (county), Omi Province and the branch family of the Yamanaka-clan which was one of Koga 21 families. (He split up with the branch family in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts)

He was from Koga County of Omi Province; His family was a branch of the Yamanaka family which was one of 21 Koga families (the branch family had been split up in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts).
sen.cmt: （）内の誤訳です。文法整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was from Koga County of Omi Province; His family was a branch of the Yamanaka family which was one of 21 Koga families (the branch family had been split up in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts).

sen.j: 初め六角氏に仕えて、織田信長に六角氏が滅ぼされたのちは信長に仕え、本能寺の変ののちは柴田勝家に属し3000石を与えられ家老となる。
sen.e: He served the Rokkaku-clan at first, next Nobunaga ODA after the Rokkaku-clan was destroyed by Nobunaga, and Katsuie SHIBATA after the Honnoji Incident and Nagatoshi was given 3000 koku (koku is a unit of volume and 1-koku of rice grain is 180.39 liter) by Katsuie and became Karo (chief retainer).

He served for the Rokkaku clan first; After the clan was conquered by Nobunaga ODA, he served for Nobunaga second; After Nobunaga died due to the Honnoji Incident, Nagatoshi belonged to Katsuie SHIBATA's family third; He was given 3000 koku (koku is a unit of volume and 1-koku of rice grain is 180.39 liter) and appointed Karo (chief retainer) by Katsuie.
sen.cmt: わかりやすいように、全体を整理しました。
sen.e: He served for the Rokkaku clan first; After the clan was conquered by Nobunaga ODA, he served for Nobunaga second; after Nobunaga died due to the Honnoji Incident, Nagatoshi belonged to Katsuie SHIBATA's family third; He was given 3000 koku (koku is a unit of volume and 1-koku of rice grain is 180.39 liter) and appointed Karo (chief retainer) by Katsuie.

sen.j: 勝家が滅びたのちは丹羽長秀に仕える。
sen.e: After Katsuie was fallen, Nagatoshi served Nagahide NIWA.
After the Katsuie's family collapsed, Nagatoshi served for Nagahide NIWA.
sen.cmt: collocationの関係から、was fallen→collaspedに訂正しました。 forを追加しました。
sen.e: After the Katsuie's family collapsed, Nagatoshi served for Nagahide NIWA.

sen.j: 長秀の没後、丹羽家中が乱れた為、堀秀政に寄食した。
sen.e: After Nagahide had died, the Niwa family was disorganized so Nagatoshi lived off Hidemasa HORI and later he was called by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and became Toyotomi's yuhitsu (amanuensis).

After Nagahide died, the Niwa family became domestically disordered; Due to this confusion, Nagatoshi lived off Hidemasa HORI; Later he was called by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and became Yuhitsu (amanuensis) of the Toyotomi family.
sen.cmt: After Nagahide had died, the Niwa family was disorganized soの部分を自然な表現に訂正しました。
sen.e: The Niwa family became domestically disordered after Nagahide died and it caused Nagatoshi to lived off Hidemasa HORI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: のちに豊臣秀吉に召し出され右筆となる。
sen.e: Later he was called by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI and became Yuhitsu (amanuensis) of the Toyotomi family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 天正18年（1590年）、小田原の役、奥州仕置に従軍し、外交折衝などで活躍した。
sen.e: In 1590, Nagatoshi took part in a military campaign for the Siege of Odawara and Oshu-shioki (repression of the Oshu District), and was active in diplomatic negotiation and so on.
In 1590, Nagatoshi joined the army in the Siege of Odawara and Oshu-shioki (repression of the Oshu District), in which he played a great role in negotiating and other activities.
sen.cmt: I removed the word "diplomactic" from the original translation, because I was not sure if I could use it in this case.
sen.e: In 1590, Nagatoshi joined the army in the Siege of Odawara and Oshu-shioki (repression of the Oshu District), in which he played a great role in negotiation and other activities.

sen.j: 文禄元年（1592年）文禄の役では肥前国名護屋城に在陣。
sen.e: At the Bunroku War in 1592, he set up a camp in Nagoya-jo Castle of Hizen Province.
On the Bunroku War in 1592, he took up a camp of his troops around Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: On the Bunroku War in 1592, he took up a camp of his troops around Nagoya-jo Castle in Hizen Province.

sen.j: 文禄2年（1593年）以降、豊臣家蔵入地の越前国北袋銀山代官、筑前国蔵入地代官等を歴任し、同年9月に100石を加増された。
sen.e: After 1593, he successively worked in different positions such as a local governor of Kitabukuro-ginzan, Echizen Province of land directly-controlled by the Toyotomi family, a local governor of land directly-controlled by Chikuzen Province, and in September, 1593, gained additional 100 koku.

Since 1593, he successively took different positions, such as a local governor of a land which was directly controlled by theToyotomi family, whose land was located in Kitabukuro-ginzan of Echizen Province, and another local governor of another directly-controlled land which was located in Chikuzen Province; In September of the same year, he was given another 100 koku in addition to his property.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: Since 1593, he successively took different positions, such as a local governor of a land which was directly controlled by theToyotomi family, whose land was located in Kitabukuro-ginzan of Echizen Province, and another local governor of another directly-controlled land which was located in Chikuzen Province; in September of the same year, he was given another 100 koku in addition to his property.

sen.j: 山城守に叙任され、文禄4年（1595年）には、一万石となり諸侯に列した。
sen.e: Nagatoshi was appointed to Yamashiro no kami (the governor of Yamashiro Province) and in 1595, he possessed approximately 10,000 koku and as a result, ranked with lords.
Nagatoshi was appointed "Yamashiro no kami" (the governor of Yamashiro Province); In 1595, he owned 10,000 koku, which gave him the title lord.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: Nagatoshi was appointed "Yamashiro no kami" (the governor of Yamashiro Province); in 1595, he owned 10,000 koku, which gave him the title lord.

sen.j: 所領は摂津国西三郡、河内国中部、近江国、伊勢国にも散見していた。
sen.e: His shoryo (territory) was appeared even in Seisan-gun (county), Settsu Province, the central part of Kawachi Province, Omi Province and Ise Province.
His shoryo (territories) were located separately; some were in Seisan County of Settsu Province, some in the central part of Kawachi Province, some in Omi Province and also some in Ise Province.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、訂正しました。
sen.e: His shoryo (territories) were located separately; some were in Seisan County of Settsu Province, some in the central part of Kawachi Province, some in Omi Province and also some in Ise Province.

sen.j: その後、畿内の蔵入地3万石の代官となる。
sen.e: Later he became a local governor who had 30,000 koku of directly-controlled land in and around the capital.
Later he became a local governor who owned 30,000 koku of directly-controlled lands in and around the capital.
Later he became a local governor who owned 30,000 koku of directly-controlled lands in and around the capital.

sen.j: 秀吉の命により太平記の続書として長編歴史書「中古日本治乱記」を執筆。
sen.e: He wrote a full-length history book called 'Chuko Nihon Chiranki' (literally, the History of Peace and War of medieval Japan) as the sequel of Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace) by order of Hideyoshi.

He worked on writing a full-length history book called 'Chuko Nihon Chiranki' (literally, the History of Peace and War of medieval Japan) which was commissioned by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI because Hideyoshi wanted a book sequel to Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace).
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: He worked on writing a full-length history book called 'Chuko Nihon Chiranki' (literally, the History of Peace and War of medieval Japan) which was commissioned by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI because Hideyoshi wanted a book sequel to Taiheiki (The Record of the Great Peace).

sen.j: 貞治元年（1362年）から慶長2年（1597年）まで執筆したところで秀吉が没したが、のちに太田資方の勧めで増補し、関ヶ原の戦いの終結までを執筆して完成させた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi died when Nagatoshi finished writing the history from 1362 to 1597, but he enlarged the history book on Sukekata OTA's advice, continued writing it up to the end of the Battle of Sekigahara and completed it.

Hideyoshi died when Nagatoshi finished a part of the book: history from 1362 to 1597; In spite of Hideyoshi's death, he expanded the content of the book because of Sukekata OTA's advice; He continued writing about history until the end of the Battle of Sekigahara; Eventually, he finally completed the book.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: Hideyoshi died when Nagatoshi finished a part of the book: history from 1362 to 1597; in spite of Hideyoshi's death, he expanded the content of the book because of Sukekata OTA's advice; He continued writing about history until the end of the Battle of Sekigahara; Eventually, he finally completed the book.

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いの際は西軍に属し大坂城留守居・守備隊として大坂城周辺を守備した。
sen.e: At the Battle of Sekigahara, he belonged to the West squad and defended around Osaka-jo Castle as rusui (keeper) and a garrison of Osaka-jo Castle.
On the Battle of Sekigahara, he belonged to the West squad and was in charge of defending around Osaka-jo Castle as rusui (keeper) and a garrison of Osaka-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: On the Battle of Sekigahara, he belonged to the West squad and was in charge of defending around Osaka-jo Castle as rusui (keeper) and a garrison of Osaka-jo Castle.

sen.j: この為、戦後に改易となり、京に隠棲し同地で没する。
sen.e: Due to the defeat, he had to change his rank so he went into seclusion in Kyoto and died there.
After the battle, because the West squad was defeated, he was forced to change his rank; He went into seclusion in Kyoto and died there.
sen.cmt: 自然な文章になるよう訂正しました。
sen.e: After the battle, because the West squad was defeated, he was forced to change his rank; he went into seclusion in Kyoto and died there.

sen.j: 墓は、西教寺（現・大津市）。
sen.e: His grave is in Saikyo-ji Temple (now in Otsu City).
His tomb is located in Saikyo-ji Temple (the present Otsu City).
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: His tomb is located in Saikyo-ji Temple (the present Otsu City).

sen.j: 法名、紹春。
sen.e: His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Syoshun.
His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Syoshun.
His homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) is Syoshun.

sen.j: 長俊の孫（信俊の子）の山中幸俊は、豊臣秀頼に仕え、大坂の役に参加した。
sen.e: Yukitoshi YAMANAKA, Nagatoshi's grandson (and the son of Nobutoshi), served Hideyori TOYOTOMI and joined the Siege of Osaka.
Yukitoshi YAMANAKA who was Nagatoshi's grandson (Nobutoshi's son) served for Hideyori TOYOTOMI and joined the army on the Siege of Osaka.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: Yukitoshi YAMANAKA who was Nagatoshi's grandson (Nobutoshi's son) served for Hideyori TOYOTOMI and joined the army on the Siege of Osaka.

sen.j: 豊臣家滅亡後、京に隠棲ののち、浅野長晟に仕え、子孫は広島藩士として存続したという。
sen.e: After the fall of the TOYOTOMI family, he went into seclusion in Kyoto and served Nagaakira ASANO, and his descendants persisted as feudal retainer of the Horoshima clan.
After fall of the Toyoyomi family, he was secluded in Kyoto for a while; Later he served for Nagaakira ASANO; It is said that his descendants kept remaining as feudal retainers of the Hiroshima clan.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。スペルミスHoroshima→Hiroshimaに訂正しました。
sen.e: After fall of the Toyoyomi family, he was secluded in Kyoto for a while; Later he served for Nagaakira ASANO; it is said that his descendants kept remaining as feudal retainers of the Hiroshima clan.

sen.j: また、信俊の次男の山中宗俊は、徳川家康に仕え、慶長14年（1609年）に1000石を賜り旗本となり、こちらは大坂の役では永井直勝の組に属し従軍した。
sen.e: Moreover, Munetoshi YAMANAKA, Nobutoshi's second son, served Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and became hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), having received 1,000 koku in 1609, and at the Siege of Osaka, he belonged to Naokatsu NAGAI's army and served on active duty.

Munetoshi YAMANAKA who was Nobutoshi's second son served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA; Munetoshi became hatamoto (direct retainer of bakufu which was the Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) by receiving 1,000 koku in 1609; he joined the army on the Siege of Osaka, who belonged to Naokatsu NAGAI's troop.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: Munetoshi YAMANAKA who was Nobutoshi's second son served for Ieyasu TOKUGAWA; Munetoshi became hatamoto (direct retainer of bakufu which was the Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) by receiving 1,000 koku in 1609; he joined the army on the Siege of Osaka, who belonged to Naokatsu NAGAI's troop.

sen.j: 子孫は旗本として存続している。
sen.e: His descendants persisted as hatamoto.
His descendants still remain as hatamoto.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、語句を訂正しました。
sen.e: His descendants still remain as hatamoto.
